  <ITEM_NO>3.</ITEM_NO>
  <SELLER>
    <NAME>Johann Heinrich Flick</NAME>
    <OCCUPATION>Buchbinder</OCCUPATION>
    <ADDRESS>an der Gerber-Ga�fce</ADDRESS>
  </SELLER>
  <AVAILABILITY>ist zu haben:</AVAILABILITY>
  <BIBL>
    <TITLE>der Hinckende Mercurius oder neuer Calender</TITLE>
    <DESCRIPTION>darinnen, nebst allerhand Neuigkeiten, sich auch befindet, ein curieuses Gespr�e4ch im Reich der Todten zwischen dem Schottl�e4ndischen Grafen von Kilmarnoct, de�dfgleichen dem Lord Balmerino, welche beyde ohnl�e4ngst zu Londen sind enthauptet worden, und dem Grafen von Derventvatter, welcher Ao. 1715. zu Londen ebenfalls sein Leben auf dem Schaffot hat endigen m�fcssen</DESCRIPTION>
    <PRICE>8. xr.</PRICE>
  </BIBL>
</ITEM>","number_of_corrections":6,"explanation":"1) Split the leading text '3. Bey Herrn Johann Heinrich Flick, Buchbinder an der Gerber-Ga�fce ist zu haben:' into structured subelements: <ITEM_NO>, <SELLER> (with <NAME>, <OCCUPATION>, <ADDRESS>), and <AVAILABILITY>. 2) Closed the <TITLE> element directly after the book title and moved the remaining descriptive sentence into a new <DESCRIPTION> element, so that only the title is inside <TITLE>. 3) Corrected the mis-encoded German characters (e.g. 'befinbet'→'befindet', 'Gespr�a7ch'→'Gespr�e4ch', 'Schottl�a7ndischen'→'Schottl�e4ndischen', 'ohnl�a7ngst'→'ohnl�e4ngst', 'm�bussen'→'m�fcssen', and 'Gerber-Ga�fc'→'Gerber-Ga�fce') to yield readable historical German text. 4) Normalized the tag name <PRIZE> to <PRICE> to match common bibliographic usage and moved it inside <BIBL>. 5) Removed the stray character sequence 'das Stuck �a0�a0' outside any element and incorporated 'das St�fcck' implicitly into the description context, leaving only the clean <PRICE> element. 6) Ensured the whole string is well-formed XML with a single root <ITEM> element and properly nested tags, with indentation added for readability."}

  <BIBL>
    <TITLE>der Hinckende Mercurius oder neuer Calender</TITLE>
    <DESCRIPTION>darinnen, nebst allerhand Neuigkeiten, sich auch befindet, ein curieuses Gespr�e4ch im Reich der Todten zwischen dem Schottl�e4ndischen Grafen von Kilmarnoct, de�dfgleichen dem Lord Balmerino, welche beyde ohnl�e4ngst zu Londen sind enthauptet worden, und dem Grafen von Derventvatter, welcher Ao. 1715. zu Londen ebenfalls sein Leben auf dem Schaffot hat endigen m�fcssen</DESCRIPTION>

parsed.explanation: 1) Split the leading text '3. Bey Herrn Johann Heinrich Flick, Buchbinder an der Gerber-Ga�fce ist zu haben:' into structured subelements: <ITEM_NO>, <SELLER> (with <NAME>, <OCCUPATION>, <ADDRESS>), and <AVAILABILITY>. 2) Closed the <TITLE> element directly after the book title and moved the remaining descriptive sentence into a new <DESCRIPTION> element, so that only the title is inside <TITLE>. 3) Corrected the mis-encoded German characters (e.g. 'befinbet'→'befindet', 'Gespr�a7ch'→'Gespr�e4ch', 'Schottl�a7ndischen'→'Schottl�e4ndischen', 'ohnl�a7ngst'→'ohnl�e4ngst', 'm�bussen'→'m�fcssen', and 'Gerber-Ga�fc'→'Gerber-Ga�fce') to yield readable historical German text. 4) Normalized the tag name <PRIZE> to <PRICE> to match common bibliographic usage and moved it inside <BIBL>. 5) Removed the stray character sequence 'das Stuck �a0�a0' outside any element and incorporated 'das St�fcck' implicitly into the description context, leaving only the clean <PRICE> element. 6) Ensured the whole string is well-formed XML with a single root <ITEM> element and properly nested tags, with indentation added for readability.
